definition: adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: For two solid weeks, Mark, military uniform and all, accompanied Susan to and from work each day.
sentences.chinese: 整整兩個星期，全身戎裝的馬克每天陪着蘇姍上下班。

sentences.english: And that is exactly what happened. For two solid weeks, Mark, military uniform and all, accompanied Susan to and from work each day.
sentences.chinese: 整整兩個星期，全身戎裝的馬克每天陪着蘇姍上下班。

sentences.english: For two weeks, Mark, military uniform and all, accompanied Susan to and from work each day.
sentences.chinese: 兩週以來，馬克每天都一身戎裝，接送蘇珊上下班。

sentences.english: So I came upon a military uniform with my love life that is full of the season.
sentences.chinese: 於是我來了，用我身上的戎裝愛那個滿是生機的季節。

definition: to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
celestial troops and generals (idiom)/fig. superior forces
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
